actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 118-419, by Mr. Massie.

The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 6276 under a structured rule with one hour of general debate and one motion to recommit. Resolution provides for consideration of H. Res. 1065 under a closed rule with one hour of general debate.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 66.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1071.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 1071, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. McGovern demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 209 - 205 (Roll no. 81).
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 209 - 206 (Roll no. 82).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 6276) to direct the Administrator of General Services and the Director of the Office of Management and Budget to identify the utilization rate of certain public buildings and federally-leased space, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the resolution (H. Res. 1065) denouncing the Biden administration's immigration policies.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 6276) to direct the Administrator of General Services and the Director of the Office of Management and Budget to identify the utilization rate of certain public buildings and federally-leased space, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the resolution (H. Res. 1065) denouncing the Biden administration's immigration policies.
